# 5.6 MUTATION AND GENETIC VARIATIONS

## TYPES OF MUTATIONS

| MUTATION TYPE | DESCRIPTION |
|--------------|-------------|
| Point Mutation | Change in single base pair |
| Frame-shift Mutation | Insertion/deletion of base pairs |
| Chromosomal Mutation | Change in chromosome structure |

## CHROMOSOMAL DISORDERS

| DISORDER | CHARACTERISTICS |
|----------|----------------|
| Klinefelter Syndrome | Male, tall, feminine features, sterile |
| Turner Syndrome | Female, short stature, webbed neck |
| Down Syndrome | Mental retardation, flat face |

## MENDELIAN LAWS

| LAW | PRINCIPLE |
|-----|-----------|
| Law of Dominance | In heterozygous, only dominant trait expresses |
| Law of Segregation | Alleles separate during gamete formation |
| Law of Independent Assortment | Genes for different traits segregate independently |

## SEX DETERMINATION SYSTEMS

| SYSTEM | FEMALE | MALE | EXAMPLES |
|--------|--------|------|----------|
| XX-XY | XX | XY | Humans, Drosophila |
| ZZ-ZW | ZW | ZZ | Birds, Butterflies |
| XX-XO | XX | XO | Grasshoppers |

[NOTE]
Mutations are sudden heritable changes in genetic material that cause genetic variations.
[/NOTE]

[IMPORTANT]
DNA fingerprinting uses Variable Number Tandem Repeats (VNTRs) for identification.
[/IMPORTANT]
